name: Cook-Cook
detailed_location: North ofSouth Vegas ruins west entrance

topics.topic_text: Why do they call you Cook-Cook?
topics.response_text: If I had to guess, it's because I cook shit for the rest of the gang. I'm a{draw this out}good cook. Maybe I'll make you dinner sometime.

topics.topic_text: Oh. You've got a little pet. How sweet.
topics.response_text: {Even creepier baby talk}You are! Yes that's right!

topics.topic_text: Do you know Violet and Driver Nephi?
topics.response_text: Course I do. You want to meet them? Heh. Even money whether Violet's dogs rip you apart or Nephi caves in your skull with that iron of his.

topics.topic_text: So, you cook all these animals around here?
topics.response_text: That's right. Brahmin, mole rats, lizards... the occasional traveler lost in the wrong part of town.
Who am I? I'm the scariest motherfucker you're ever gonna meet. I'm Cook-Cook, bitch, better not forget it.

topics.topic_text: What do you think of the NCR?
topics.response_text: NCR? Bunch of soft little bitches, they've got no stomach for life in the wasteland. Got some choice strange, though, I'll give 'em that.
*That's* Queenie. She's the prettiest Brahmin in the Wastelands.{Really creepy baby talk}Aren't you, Queenie, yes you are, who's a good girl?

conversation.response_text: No! Queenie! Hahahaha! I'm going to burn the world for you, Queenie!

description:
Cook-Cook is a 45 year-old Caucasian Male.

A high-ranking member of the Fiends, second only to Motor-Runner. Cook-Cook is a notorious sociopath with a borderline amorous affection for his pet brahmin, Queenie. He gained his name not just because he prefers fire-based weapons to feed his pyromania, but also because he is an allegedly exceptional, if unhygienic, cook.

Cook-Cook's Personality: Depraved sociopath with pyromania and an unusual attachment to his brahmin. He's violent, unpredictable, and takes pleasure in the suffering of others. Despite his brutality, he shows a strange tenderness toward his pet brahmin.

Cook-Cook's Backstory: Once a raider who wandered the Mojave, Cook-Cook's descent into madness accelerated after the loss of his original brahmin companion. He found solace in fire, becoming increasingly obsessed with flames and their destructive power. His cooking skills, which were once merely functional, became twisted as he incorporated his love for fire into his culinary practices. Through a combination of brutality and cunning, he rose through the ranks of the Fiends to become Motor-Runner's second-in-command.
